text: Robert Francis "Bobby" Kennedy (November 20, 1925 â€“ June 6, 1968), also called RFK, was an American politician. He is the brother of former U.S. President John F. Kennedy, who was killed while riding in a presidential motorcade through Dealey Plaza in the Assassination of John F. Kennedy nearly five years before Robert's death. Like his brother, he was assassinated. == Death == Kennedy ran for president in 1968, but was shot multiple times by Sirhan Sirhan in California during the presidential primaries on June 5, 1968. He died during the operation to remove the bullet and bone fragments from his brain on the next day. == References == == Other websites == *PBS video on RFK, with long quotes by historians *The Coalition on Political Assassinations Category:1925 births Category:1968 deaths Category:People from Brookline, Massachusetts Category:American Roman Catholics Category:Burials at Arlington National Cemetery Category:Harvard University alumni Category:Kennedy family Category:Murders by firearm in California Category:People murdered in California Category:Politicians from Massachusetts Category:United States Attorneys General Category:1968 United States presidential candidates Category:United States senators from New York (state) Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Lawyers from Massachusetts Category:Assassinated American politicians
title: Robert F. Kennedy
